key_title: Key to the species of Pomaderris

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Rhamnaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Pomaderris
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1999). Pomaderris. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves narrow-ovate to narrow-obovate, oblong or linear, at least 3.5 times as long as wide, no more than 15 mm wide
Leaves not more than 3.5 times as long as wide, often wider than 15 mm
Leaves glabrous above
Leaves variously pubescent or hispid above
Indumentum of internerves on lower surface of leaves of stellate hairs only
Indumentum of internerves on lower surface of leaves including at least some simple hairs
Margins of leaves strongly recurved to revolute; ovary glabrous (rarely with a few scattered hairs), superior, surrounded by flat floral disc; petals absent
Margins of leaves plane to weakly revolute
Flowers c. sessile in tight, bracteate clusters; leaves ovate to obovate; stipules narrow-triangular to ovate; sepals deciduous; scattered in east of State
Flowers distinctly pedicellate; leaves c. oblong; stipules linear-filiform; sepals persistent in fruit; Snowy River endemic
Flowers petalous; simple hairs of leaf undersurface closely appressed
Flowers apetalous; simple hairs beneath somewhat spreading
Leaves to 20 mm long, 1.5 mm wide; lower surface obscured by revolute margins; stipules persistent
Leaves (25–) 40 mm long or more, 7–30 mm wide; lower surface not obscured by revolute margins; stipules deciduous
Ovary glabrous (rarely with a few scattered hairs), almost or quite superior, surrounded by obvious floral disc
Ovary pubescent, at least partly inferior (usually inferior), floral disc apparently absent
Leaf upper surface with stellate hairs
Leaf upper surface hispid with simple hairs
Leaf upper surface sparsely to moderately hispid with rather coarse simple hairs at least 0.1 mm long; leaf margins recurved to revolute; flowers yellowish; sepals deciduous
Leaf upper surface with mostly stellate hairs; leaf margins not or hardly recurved; flowers greenish to deep red; sepals persistent
Leaves with secondary veins impressed above, apparent on lower surface, margin quite entire; stipules deciduous; ovary c. inferior; fruit obtuse; operculum c. half mericarp length
Leaves with secondary veins not or hardly apparent on either surface, margins often sinuate; stipules persistent; ovary half-superior; fruit acute at apex; operculum subequal to mericarp
Leaves ±oblong, margins quite entire; largest leaves no more than 15 mm wide; hypanthium 1–1.2 mm long
Leaves  narrowly ovate to bluntly lanceolate, margins irregularly and shallowly toothed; largest leaves more than 15 mm wide; hypanthium c. 1.5 mm long
Indumentum of branchlets, leaf undersurfaces, hypanthium (and usually ovary summit) consisting only of stellate hairs (occasionally upper surfaces of leaves with simple hairs)
Indumentum of hypanthium, ovary summit, and usually branchlets and leaf undersurfaces including at least some simple hairs
Leaf margins crenate, minutely serrate, or dentate; flowers always apetalous
Leaf margins entire; flowers with or without petals
Sepals deciduous; ovary half-inferior; leaves to 30 mm long
Sepals persisting in fruit; ovary inferior, or if ever half-inferior then leaves longer than 30 mm

Sepals attached near base or at middle of mature fruit; indumentum of lower surface of leaves not extending around margin; leaves normally longer than 50 mm; inflorescence usually elongate-paniculate, usually far exceeding the subtending leaf

Sepals attached toward apex of mature fruit; indumentum of lower surface of leaves usually extending around margin to upper surface as a narrow border; leaves rarely longer than 50 mm; inflorescence usually interrupted-racemose, not or hardly exceeding the subtending leaf
Hairs on lower surface of leaf sessile, whitish, very dense and usually completely obscuring the lamina; Grampians and Corner Inlet area
All or most hairs on lower surface of leaf shortly stalked, rusty, not completely obscuring the lamina; widespread in wet forests
Leaves ovate to broadly ovate, at least 20 mm wide, with upper surfaces ±bullate with tertiary venation apparent; hypanthium 0.5–1 mm long
Leaves narrowly ovate to bluntly lanceolate, at most 15 mm wide, with upper surfaces smooth between the lateral veins and no tertiary venation apparent; hypanthium c. 1.5 mm long
Leaves toothed or sinuate for the greater part, the longest 30 mm long or more; sparsely hispid to glabrous above
Leaves toothed only toward apex, the longest usually less than 30 mm long, or if longer, then densely hispid above
Leaves mostly longer than 15 mm, densely hispid to subvelutinous above
Leaves either less than 15 mm long or glabrous above
Sepals persistent in fruit; flowers always apetalous; indumentum of lower surface of leaves usually extending around margin to upper surface as a narrow border
Sepals deciduous soon after anthesis; flowers with or without petals; indumentum of lower surface of leaves not extending around margin
Leaves mostly longer than 15 mm, densely hispid to subvelutinous above
Leaves either less than 15 mm long or glabrous above
Largest leaves more than 25 mm long, flowers usually with petals
Leaves under 25 mm long, or if ever slightly longer then flowers apetalous
Leaves strongly discolorous; lower surface whitish, the epidermis not visible beneath dense, fine stellate indumentum; flowers with petals
Leaves weakly discolous; lower surface grey-green, the epidermis clearly visible beneath the indumentum; flowers without petals
Leaves with scattered to dense hairs above
Leaves glabrous above
Leaves densely and minutely stellate pubescent above (hairs more or less obscuring lamina), often V-shaped in transverse section; flowers with petals (but these falling immediately after anthesis)
Leaves with scattered hairs above, flat or convex; flowers with or without petals
Leaves 2–8 (–11) mm long, lateral veins indistinct; flowers axillary, solitary or in small umbellate clusters
Leaves (10–) 15–20 (–30) mm long, lateral veins usually distinct; flowers in terminal and/or axillary racemes or panicles (sometimes short)
Flowers with petals; south-central Victoria only
Flowers apetalous; widespread in south
Leaves 2–8 (–11) mm long, lateral veins indistinct; flowers axillary, solitary or in small clusters
Leaves (10–) 15–20 (–30) mm long, lateral views usually distinct; flowers in slender terminal and/or axillary racemes or panicles
Inflorescences of simple terminal umbels; floral disc present; leaves cuneate, emarginate, to 26 mm long; stipules persistent; western and very rare
Inflorescence usually paniculate, if ever apparently simple-umbellate then flowers lacking disc; leaves commonly longer than 26 mm long, never cuneate; stipules commonly deciduous
Mature leaves with hairs (but sometimes very short) more or less evenly distributed over the upper surface
Mature leaves glabrous above (except sometimes along the groove of the midvein and/or secondary veins)
Lateral veins on leaves apparently not developed; leaves narrow-elliptic or narrow-ovate, to 18 mm long
Lateral veins apparent beneath (although sometimes partly obscured by dense tomentum); largest leaves longer than 18 mm
Indumentum of leaf internerves beneath of stellate hairs only
Indumentum of leaf internerves beneath including some simple hairs
Simple hairs dense, largely or entirely obscuring the underlying stellate hair layer
Simple hairs sparse to moderate, not covering more than c. 50% of underlying stellate hair layer
Flowers with petals
Flowers apetalous
Indumentum appressed, silky; flowers bright yellow
Indumentum spreading; flowers cream to dull yellow
Leaf undersurfaces covered by closely appressed, silky, golden to rusty simple hairs; leaves narrow-elliptic, to 30 mm long
Leaf indumentum and dimensions not as above
Branchlets immediately below inflorescence fine (under 1 mm diam.); stems below current season?s growth glabrous; simple hairs on leaf internerves spreading but often appressed over midvein
Branchlets immediately below inflorescence thicker than 1 mm; stem indumentum persisting for more than 1 season; simple hairs similarly spreading or appressed on leaf internerves and midvein
Floral bracts persisting to and shortly after anthesis; flowers in contracted clusters; leaves to 40 mm long, with lateral veins deeply impressed on upper surface; margins not undulate

Floral bracts falling before anthesis; flowers in rather loose panicles; leaves usually longer than 40 mm, lateral veins apparent but not deeply impressed on upper surface; margins often slightly undulate
Flowers with petals
Flowers apetalous
Simple hairs of leaves silky, appressed or semi-appressed; floral bracts persisting to anthesis (but falling soon after); flowers in compact clusters
Simple hairs of leaves somewhat spreading, hardly silky; floral bracts falling well before anthesis; flowers in rather loose panicles
Flowers bright yellow or golden; petals usually auriculate, distinctly clawed at base
Flowers pale, cream to pale yellow (rarely golden); petals obovate, tapered more or less evenly to the base
Indumentum pale; simple hairs rather sparse, straight or weakly curved; leaves acute at base and apex; margin recurved
Indumentum rusty; simple hairs sparse to dense, strongly curved or wavy; leaves generally obtuse at least at base; margin usually plane, rarely recurved
Leaves acutely tapered to base and apex, simple hairs very sparse and inconspicuous; margins recurved, not undulate
Leaves obtuse at least at base, simple hairs sparse (but conspicuous) to rather dense; margins not or rarely recurved, commonly undulate
Leaves ovate to broadly ovate, to 50 mm long, up to 1.5–2.5 times as long as wide; margins often weakly undulate
Leaves narrow-ovate to oblong, mostly 40–60 (–90) mm long, more than 2.5 times as long as wide; margins not undulate
Inflorescence of several small bracteate clusters; pedicels 0.5–1 mm long, shorter than hypanthium
Bracts deciduous before anthesis; inflorescence paniculate; pedicels longer than hypanthium
Flowers with petals
Flowers apetalous
Flowers pale yellow or whitish; petals more or less evenly tapered to an indistinct claw; leaf margins recurved
Flowers bright yellow; petals auriculate or abruptly tapered from a broad apical region to a distinct basal claw; leaf margins never recurved
Simple hairs on hypanthium, sepals and veins of leaves very short and sparse; leaves 30–90 mm long
Simple hairs on hypanthium and sepals sparse to mid-dense, those of the leaf mid-vein sparse but relatively long and threadlike; leaves (20–) 25–35 (–50) mm long
Leaves c. evenly and finely greyish stellate-pubescent below, rarely with a few rusty hairs present; margins not toothed (but sometimes weakly crenate or emarginate)
Leaves with rusty stellate hairs on veins and internerves below, larger and coarser than underlying whitish indumentum; margins toothed or entire

Leaves broad-ovate to broad-obovate (distinctly more than half as wide as long), emarginate or very obtuse at apex, broadly obtuse at base; margins not recurved; lateral veins rather strongly impressed on leaf upper surface
Leaves elliptic, acutely tapered at base and apex; margin recurved; lateral veins not much impressed on leaf upper surface
Largest leaves no more than 25 mm long; upper surface glossy, not wrinkled; apex truncate truncate or emarginate; margins entire
Largest leaves more than 25 mm long; upper surface dull and usually distinctly wrinkeld; apex acute; margins usually toothed to some extent.
Leaves sinuate to dentate, and/or lateral veins terminating in short hair tufts extending shortly beyond the margin; margin commonly recurved
Leaves entire, lateral veins not terminating in hair tufts extending beyond the margin; margin usually plane
Young stems and veins on undersurfaces of leaves lacking simple hairs; upper surfaces sparsely hispid
Young stems and veins on undersurfaces of leaves with simple hairs; upper surfaces hispid to velutinous
Inflorescence of several small bracteate clusters; pedicels 0.5–1 mm long, shorter than hypanthium
Bracts deciduous before anthesis; inflorescence c. paniculate; pedicels longer than hypanthium
Leaves broad-ovate to broad-obovate, distinctly less than twice as long as wide, c. evenly and finely greyish stellate-pubescent below, rarely with a few rusty hairs present; margins weakly crenate

Leaves ovate to obovate, sometimes narrowly so, c. twice (or more) as long as wide, with prominent rusty stellate hairs on veins and internerves below, larger and coarser than underlying whitish indumentum; margins usually distinctly toothed

Inflorescence of several small bracteate clusters; floral bracts persisting until anthesis; flowers subsessile; leaves not much longer than wide, densely hispid above with prominent marginal hair-tufts

Inflorescences paniculate (but sometimes very short); floral bracts falling well before anthesis; flowers distinctly pedicellate; leaves c. twice as long as wide or more, with no or minute marginal hair tufts
Longest leaves no more than 12 mm long; flowers pale cream; petals shortly united to anther filament bases,deciduous soon after anthesis; very rare shrub of Myrtleford area in north-east Victoria
Longest leaves longer than 12 mm; flowers yellow; petals not confluent with anther filaments, at least somewhat persistent
Hairs on leaf upper surface sparse; simple hairs on young stems and leaf undersurfaces lacking or extremely sparse
Hairs on leaf upper surface moderately to very dense; simple hairs abundant on young stems and leaf undersurfaces
Leaves broad-ovate to broad-obovate, distinctly less than twice as long as wide, c. evenly and finely greyish stellate-pubescent below, rarely with a few rusty hairs present crenate

Leaves ovate to obovate, sometimes narrowly so, c. twice (or more) as long as wide, with prominent rusty stellate hairs on veins and internerves below, larger and coarser than underlying whitish indumentum
Largest leaves no more than 25 mm long; upper surface glossy, very sparsely  hispid, not wrinkled; apex truncate truncate or emarginate
Largest leaves more than 25 mm long; upper surface dull and usually distinctly hispid, wrinkeld; apex acute

Inflorescences of dense subglobular clusters, partly enclosed by persistent floral bracts; petals present or absent; leaf upper surface shortly and densely hispid to subvelutinous; simple hairs on leaf undersurface confined to veins

Inflorescence paniculate, floral bracts deciduous before anthesis; petals always present; leaf upper surface minutely velutinous, or if hispid to subvelutinous, then simple hairs on undersurface not confined to veins
Simple hairs on leaf undersurface fine and thread-like, confined to veins; upper surface greyish, velutinous with minute stellate hairs
Simple hairs on leaf undersurface not confined to veins; upper surface green, hispid to velutinous with simple or mixed simple and stellate hairs

Simple hairs on young stems and leaf undersurfaces straight to slightly curved, those of internerves sparse to mid-dense, mostly pale; sepals mostly shorter than 2 mm; inflorescences usually pyramidal, 2–5 cm diam

Simple hairs on young stems and leaf undersurfaces strongly flexuose or curled, those of internerves mid-dense to very dense, rusty; sepals mostly longer than 2 mm; inflorescence usually hemispherical, 4–12 cm diam
